intro: Lepidagathis timorensis, commonly known as the Timor lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of forests and is adapted to tropical climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
